channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: NYPD releases 2 new photos of man sought in killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO
item.description: Late Saturday, police released two additional photos of the suspected shooter that appeared to be from a camera mounted inside a taxi.
item.content:encoded:
Late Saturday, police released two additional photos of the suspected shooter that appeared to be from a camera mounted inside a taxi.

(Image credit: NYPD)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: John Lithgow on having a "good ending" — on and off screen
item.description: Actor John Lithgow grew up in a theater family but always wanted to be a painter. On Wild Card this week, he opens up what changed his mind.
item.content:encoded:
Actor John Lithgow grew up in a theater family but always wanted to be a painter. On Wild Card this week, he opens up what changed his mind.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: In Syria, the Assads leave a bitter legacy after a half-century of repressive rule
item.description: President Bashar Assad and his father, Hafez Assad, combined to rule Syria for more than 50 years, always with an iron fist that crushed dissent and relied on the country's feared security forces.
item.content:encoded:
President Bashar Assad and his father, Hafez Assad, combined to rule Syria for more than 50 years, always with an iron fist that crushed dissent and relied on the country's feared security forces.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Syrian government falls to rebels, in stunning end to 50 year iron rule of the Assads
item.description: The Syrian government collapsed early Sunday, falling to a lightning rebel offensive that seized control of the capital of Damascus and sent crowds into the streets to celebrate.
item.content:encoded:
The Syrian government collapsed early Sunday, falling to a lightning rebel offensive that seized control of the capital of Damascus and sent crowds into the streets to celebrate.

(Image credit: Omar Sanadiki/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Photos: Notre Dame Cathedral reopens, with its first service since a devastating fire
item.description: The bells of Notre Dame Cathedral rang on Saturday evening in Paris for the first time since a fire heavily damaged the Paris landmark in 2019.
item.content:encoded:
The bells of Notre Dame Cathedral rang on Saturday evening in Paris for the first time since a fire heavily damaged the Paris landmark in 2019.

(Image credit: Ludovic Marin)
item.dc:creator: James Doubek

item.title: Ukrainians face another harsh winter as Russia attacks coal country
item.description: Many Ukrainians continue to leave their coal mining towns, with the front line of the war with Russia nearby.
item.content:encoded:
Many Ukrainians continue to leave their coal mining towns, with the front line of the war with Russia nearby.

(Image credit: Michael Robinson Chávez for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Michael Robinson Chávez

item.title: Insurgents reach gates of Syria's capital, threatening to upend decades of Assad rule
item.description: Insurgents' stunning march across Syria accelerated Saturday with news that they had reached the gates of the capital and that government forces had abandoned the central city of Homs.
item.content:encoded:
Insurgents' stunning march across Syria accelerated Saturday with news that they had reached the gates of the capital and that government forces had abandoned the central city of Homs.

(Image credit: Ghaith Alsayed)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Photographer pays homage to Our Lady of Guadalupe and reclaims her connection with the divine
item.description: Our Lady of Guadalupe is a significant religious figure who signifies hope and protection for countless Latinos in the U.S. and abroad. For photographer Amanda Lopez, she's an emblem of home.
item.content:encoded:
Our Lady of Guadalupe is a significant religious figure who signifies hope and protection for countless Latinos in the U.S. and abroad. For photographer Amanda Lopez, she's an emblem of home.

(Image credit: Amanda Lopez)
item.dc:creator: Pablo Valdivia

item.title: Musk and Ramaswamy's DOGE echoes past budget promises that faced big hurdles
item.description: Vows to shrink the deficit, pay down the debt and run government more like a business have long been a stock element of politics. Candidates for office who have business backgrounds made it a mantra.
item.content:encoded:
Vows to shrink the deficit, pay down the debt and run government more like a business have long been a stock element of politics. Candidates for office who have business backgrounds made it a mantra.

(Image credit: Roberto Schmidt)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: A wolf walks into a flower — and appears to pollinate it
item.description: The bees and ... the wolves? Turns out, the Ethiopian wolf may be a pollinator, too.
item.content:encoded:
The bees and ... the wolves? Turns out, the Ethiopian wolf may be a pollinator, too.

(Image credit: Danielle Rubens)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel
